recipe_name: Sea bass ceviche with sesame dressing
author: Nick Nairn
method: Slice the sea bass fillet thinly using a very sharp knife. Arrange the sea bass slices on a serving plate and sprinkle over the lime juice, zest, vegetable oil, sesame seeds, sesame oil and soy sauce. Set aside to marinate for around 15 minutes - don't leave it any longer or the fish will begin to break down. To serve, heat a griddle pan and chargrill the lime half, cut-side down, until lightly charred. Place the lime onto the serving plate and garnish with the tomatoes, dill and chives.
ingredients: ½ very fresh sea bass fillet,  1 lime, juice and zest,  1 tsp vegetable oil,  1 tsp sesame seeds,  ½ tsp sesame oil,  1 tsp soy sauce,  ½ lime,  2 vine tomatoes, cut into wedges,  sprig fresh dill,  1 tbsp chopped fresh chives
